After working with Inori and Maika to get Akane\nfired up again, the passing days had been\nso pleasant.%K%P
'That's it for today.'%K%P
I closed the book I was reading and stretched.%K%P
The book recommended to me by Inori was\nunexpectedly good, time just zoomed passed.%K%P
'Better get some coffee.'%K%P
'Oh, Inori?'%K%P
'Sho?'%K%P
When I entered the living room,\nInori looked serious, deep in thought.%K%P
'Did something happen?'%K%P
'Oh, well... I-It's nothing.'%K%P
She must have been thinking really hard\nsince she didn't notice me until I spoke to her.%K%P
Because of that, she hurried to\nput a smile on her face.%K%P
'Are you concerned about something?'%K%P
'There is something on my mind, but it's nothing\nyou need to worry about, Sho.'%K%P
It was unusual for Inori to hide things like that.%K%P
It made me curious.%K%P
'Ah, seems like you don't trust me, Inori...\nWhen I trust you so much.'%K%P
'What?! No, That's not true!\nI trust you, Sho!'%K%P
'Then, tell me what's bothering you.'%K%P
'Oh, u-um...'%K%P
'See? You really don't...'%K%P
'O-Okay! I'll tell you!'%K%P
Whatever the situation, Inori was always nice.%K%P
'So, what's been bothering you?'%K%P
'Akane is very close to the people of\nKannagi, right?'%K%P
'Hmm? Yeah, it sure seems like it.'%K%P
We'd been hearing stories during dinner\nabout Akane's interactions with the people of\nthe shopping street.%K%P
From what I heard, she had\na very close relationship with them.%K%P
'After hearing those stories,\nI can't help but to think this.'%K%P
'I am the goddess of Kannagi Town,\nbut it's not like I'm close with\nits people like Akane is.'%K%P
'That's why I was thinking of ways\nto be more helpful for the people of Kannagi.'%K%P
After she released all her pent up feelings,\nshe took a sip of her tea and let out a sigh.%K%P
'Do you feel contempt towards me\nbeing jealous of Akane?'%K%P
'Why would I feel contempt?'%K%P
'You care so much about this town.\nI admire that and will never feel\ncontempt for you.'%K%P
'Sho...'%K%P
'From what you said, it sounds like you want\nto be more involved with the people of this town.'%K%P
'Y-Yes. That's true.\nBut, I just don't know what to do...'%K%P
'I'm not cheerful or assertive like Akane...'%K%P
'Hmm...'%K%P
A way to get closer to the townspeople...%K%P
Akane attracted them with her own,\nunique personality.%K%P
It'd be cruel to make the modest\nand virtuous Inori act like her.%K%P
Then, what was the best thing to do?%K%P
'Oh yeah...'%K%P
'Did you think of something?!'%K%P
Whoa, she's really serious about this.%K%P
Surprised to see Inori more active than usual,\nI cleared my throat and stated my suggestion.%K%P
'It's actually very simple.\nYou just have to make a regional contribution.'%K%P
'A regional contribution?'%K%P
Yes. You'll listen and solve the\ntownspeople's concerns.\nThat way, you'll naturally get closer to them.'%K%P
Inori made a distressed face upon hearing\nmy suggestion.%K%P
'I appreciate the suggestion Sho, but unfortunately,\nI cannot do that.'%K%P
'You can't?'%K%P
'Yes. Are you familiar with\nthe Divine Fundamental Law?'%K%P
'Hmm, I'm not too familiar with it.'%K%P
'In short, it prohibits goddesses from making\npeople's wishes come true. People are not allowed\nto utilize goddesses like that.'%K%P
'I'd like to ask you to be aware of that.'%K%P
Hmm, that's interesting.%K%P
There's a high possibility to run into that issue\nwith regional contribution.%K%P
'They're that strict about the\nDivine Fundamental Law?'%K%P
'No, as long as I don't overdo it with my powers,\nthere should be no problem.'%K%P
'There actually are goddesses\nwho use Jinriki on a regular basis.%K%P
Oh?%K%P
Inori made it seem like it was a very\nsevere regulation, but it seems like\nit's actually not that extreme.%K%P
'Then there shouldn't be any issues, right?'%K%P
'Only if it's used 'normally'.'%K%P
'However, the goddess who's my superior is\nvery strict on laws and regulations.'%K%P
'She is very hard to please and is very strict\nwhen it comes to following them.'%K%P
Ah, it sounded like this goddess was the serious,\nuptight type.%K%P
'Inori, it's not like you want to spread your name\nas the goddess of this region, right?'%K%P
'Right. I'm not looking to be respected like that.\nI just want all residents to be happy living here.'%K%P
'And if possible, I always want to see their smiles.\nI believe that's how I should be as a goddess.'%K%P
'I see. Then you can help out as just Inori,\nnot as the goddess Inori.'%K%P
'What?'%K%P
'Don't use Jinriki, don't spread the word\nthat you're a goddess. Maybe they'd consider it\nunder these conditions?'%K%P
'Th-That actually sounds possible. No, but...'%K%P
Inori kept mumbling as she digested the situation.%K%P
I was aware that I made an awful argument.%K%P
But I strongly felt that this was a great way for\nInori to interact with the townspeople.%K%P
'I understand that your superior is strict, but\nI think it's worth a try rather than\ngiving up off the bat.'%K%P
'Heck, I'll even go with you to ask.'%K%P
'Sho... I got it. I'll give it a try.'%K%P
'I-It got approved.'%K%P
She muttered in surprise after she came back\nfrom meeting with her boss.%K%P
'That's great.\nNow you can go ahead with\nhelping out the townspeople.'%K%P
'Yes! But, what should I do about\nthe regional contribution...'%K%P
'I'm the one who suggested it.\nSo let's come up with ideas together.'%K%P
I confidently said to reassure Inori.%K%P
'Yes! Let's think of a way together!'%K%P
